page.title: 15NETLEY MARSH STEAM RALLY
page.content: The Steam Rally site is in Netley Marsh, on the A336 between Cadnam and Totton.The Steam Rally in 1985 should raise Â£26,000 for charity in Netley Marsh village.The rally started in 1971 on a Saturday and raised Â£300 this was followed by a two day rally then a three day rally.In 1985 it is expected that about 50 to 60 engines will come,and about 50 to 60 thousand people will come over the weekend.The field in which the rally is held is owned by Mrs Coombs,it is about 20 acres and also 20 acres for parking.The price to get in is Â£2 for adults and Â£1 for children and oap's.There are many things to see and do,and in the 1985 rally,Acker Bilk and his Paramount Jazz Band and a Saturday evening barbeque.
